I thought it might be fun to do some little features on this cottage and

and it's kind of one with nature so to speak so I sculpted two little features

now I'm gonna actually start painting this and essentially you only have two

there'll be some you know obviously little detail colors on these features
I've added but for the most part it's just those two and I'm gonna use just
this basic Brown for the first coat of wood and this suede for the first coat
of stucco I'm gonna see how it looks to probably do some dry bread
some weathering and definitely a bunch of washes but we're gonna start with
these I personally on something like this
prefer to paint out all the woodwork and then cut in the color on the stucco
because as I see it it actually makes sense that if my brush hits the wood
with some of the stucco color that actually makes sense because this stucco
is applied to the building afterwards and some of that could actually work its
way onto these Timbers so it won't look weird however if there's light dabs
sorry if there's dark dabs of the dark brown on the light stucco that doesn't
make any sense because there'd be no reason for the wood color to transfer
the stucco so that's kind of the principle I have when painting it so I'm
going to skip ahead now to when that is all completely done and we'll take a

I also primed out these little antlers with a white spray primer because they

avoiding these little mushroom caps and the bird nest stuff because that'll be
the last thing I paint out with a detail brush yeah just basic two-tone colors
you know touch up any bad kind of over brushings of the suede onto the brown
and now it's time to start highlighting and weathering the wood and I'm gonna do
that by dry brushing on this tan now this tan is a little bit darker but very
similar to the suede that I used on the stucco but this is you know I don't want
to go that bright on it but this is gonna highlight all the edges and it's
going to give it that kind of gray weathered look and of course like
everything I make it's gonna get a wash after that's going to get into the deep
crevices with like black tour you know really give it some depth so when you're
doing this there's two things you to keep in mind one
is that you want to really really really make sure that this is a true dry
brushing you want to get off as much of this paint as you can you don't want to
have any smears when you're doing this you really want it to only be hitting
the highlights and the edges you don't want to have too many like big streaks
so work off a lot of that excess paint and go lightly and carefully at first
because too much of this will actually look kind of strange the other nice
thing though is that because this color is a very similar just darker to this
stucco tan it doesn't matter if you get any of this onto the stucco so you don't
have to be careful about that at all the base of the Timbers you want to go
fairly minimal and light so you just you know highlight the the grain but when
you get to the actual edges any hard corners you can let that go on a bit
heavier and that'll really highlight these edges and give it a look a little
bit more 3d pop to it so I'm just gonna finish dry brushing this all out because

saturated and you start dragging your brush across it there is a small risk of
rehydrating the paint and smearing it and getting something that looks kind of
smudgy so try to dab it when I can do these roofs now and you can tell I'm not
afraid to really get a lot on there so I'm just gonna continue with this and
I'm going to let it dry mostly and then we'll come back and see how it looks
so I've waited about an hour for the wash to dry enough that I can move on

details the and the mushrooms ahead of time in a
very light color and when I was doing the wash it was very easy to avoid them
and you know brushing around it and that wasn't a problem
but what I didn't account for was the fact that the the wash is so watery that
it would actually just like wick up onto these surfaces and you know pull down
onto them and that's what happened and it stained them and turned them pretty
dark way darker than I wanted because I don't want a black wash on these so I
did have to go in and quickly just touch up the paint on those so in the future
